We work to save lives by closing the gap between knowledge and action in public health.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Compliance Officer

Job Requisition ID: R4979
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Job type: Full-time

Overview


	The Compliance Officer will conduct verification of internal controls and compliance of all financial and operational functions in the GF-Malaria Project, Nigeria.
	The position holder will verify that all staff are well versed in donor and MSH policies and procedures and are adhering to such standards.
	S/he will identify gaps in existing internal control systems and provide recommendations to strengthen them; will identify gaps in knowledge and skills; will provide recommendations for training.


Responsibilities


	In coordination with the Senior Compliance Officer, s/he will develop a plan and evaluation tools and then carry out independent appraisals and verifications of the effectiveness of MSH and donor policies, procedures and standards, and (country) law, by which MSH (country/project) financial resources are managed.
	S/he will review and evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of operations, reliability of financial reporting, compliance with applicable laws and the safeguarding of assets.
	S/he will plan, perform and report back on internal assessments to ensure that financial control, financial guidelines of donor organization and other control procedures are in place and are being properly implemented and managed within MSH GF-Malaria Nigeria offices.
	S/he will also be responsible for advising and monitoring quality standards of operations and value for money.
	S/he will follow-up on recommendations from the internal and external auditors to ensure the recommendations have been implemented and adhered to.
	Under the direction of the Senior Compliance Officer (and MSH General Counsel, where necessary) s/he will conduct thoroughly documented investigations of whistleblower cases, and suspected fraud and will directly interface with the Director, Governance and Entity Management on these or other specific cases.


Qualification


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting or business management or related area.
	Advanced degree preferred
	Professional certification in Accounting, Internal Audit, and Fraud Examination
	Six plus years of experience in compliance, risk management or audit required.
	Extensive familiarity of Global Fund and US government grant rules and regulations and/or other donor rules and regulations (E.U, USAID, CDC, DFID) required.

Compliance Officer Job at Management Sciences for Health (MSH)




        
    

        
        The Management Sciences for Health (MSH), a global health nonprofit organization, uses proven approaches developed over 40 years to help leaders, health managers, and communities in developing nations build stronger health systems for greater health impact. We work to save lives by closing the gap between knowledge and action in public health.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Compliance Officer

Job Requisition ID: R4979
Job Location: Abuja
Job type: Full-time

Overview
     

            
    




	The Compliance Officer will conduct verification of internal controls and compliance of all financial and operational functions in the GF-Malaria Project, Nigeria.
	The position holder will verify that all staff are well versed in donor and MSH policies and procedures and are adhering to such standards.
	S/he will identify gaps in existing internal control systems and provide recommendations to strengthen them; will identify gaps in knowledge and skills; will provide recommendations for training.


Responsibilities


	In coordination with the Senior Compliance Officer, s/he will develop a plan and evaluation tools and then carry out independent appraisals and verifications of the effectiveness of MSH and donor policies, procedures and standards, and (country) law, by which MSH (country/project) financial resources are managed.
	S/he will review and evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of operations, reliability of financial reporting, compliance with applicable laws and the safeguarding of assets.
	S/he will plan, perform and report back on internal assessments to ensure that financial control, financial guidelines of donor organization and other control procedures are in place and are being properly implemented and managed within MSH GF-Malaria Nigeria offices.
	S/he will also be responsible for advising and monitoring quality standards of operations and value for money.
	S/he will follow-up on recommendations from the internal and external auditors to ensure the recommendations have been implemented and adhered to.
	Under the direction of the Senior Compliance Officer (and MSH General Counsel, where necessary) s/he will conduct thoroughly documented investigations of whistleblower cases, and suspected fraud and will directly interface with the Director, Governance and Entity Management on these or other specific cases.


Qualification


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or business management or related area.
	Advanced degree preferred
	Professional certification in Accounting, Internal Audit, and Fraud Examination
	Six plus years of experience in compliance, risk management or audit required.
	Extensive familiarity of Global Fund and US government grant rules and regulations and/or other donor rules and regulations (E.U, USAID, CDC, DFID) required.
	Experience in international development programs preferred.
	Excellent planning, management, and organizational skills.
	Proven leadership and interpersonal skill.
	Professional proficiency in English required
	Perspective, Dealing with ambiguity, Organizational Agility, Political Savvy and Strategic Agility
	Functional/Technical skills, Client Focus, Managing through systems, Managing and Measuring work, Negotiating, Information Sharing, Process Management, Priority Setting, Problem Solving and Timely Decision Making
	Ethics and Values, Integrity and Trust, Listening, Written Communication
	Adaptability, Communication, Problem Solving, Creativity and Innovation, Quality, Quality and Timeliness of Work, Quality of work and Team Relationships, Resource Utilization
	Availability to travel domestically and internationally as needed. Up to 50% domestic travel.

Sales Representative Job at Harvest Feed & Agro Processing




        
    

        
        At Harvest Feed & Agro Processing, we specialize in transforming cassava into high-quality, versatile products for both the food and agricultural industries. Our primary offerings include Venus Cassava "edible" starch and Venus cassava offals, catering to diverse sectors such as food manufacturing, livestock feed production, and organic farming.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative

Job Location: Ogun
Employment Type: Full-tim

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a highly aggressive, target-driven Sales Representative with verifiable past sales achievements to drive revenue growth across our agro-processing products.
	The ideal candidate must be hungry for results, confident in closing deals, and capable of exceeding sales targets consistently.


Key Responsibilities


	Actively prospect, develop, and close new customers and distributors
	Drive sales of company products through direct and indirect channels
	Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets
	Maintain strong relationships with existing customers to grow repeat sales
	Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and competitors
	Negotiate pricing, contracts, and payment terms within company policy
	Prepare sales reports, forecasts, and performance updates
	Follow up aggressively on leads until conversion
	Represent the company professionally in the market


Requirements


	OND / HND / BSc in Sales, Marketing, Business Administration, or related field
	3–5 years of sales experience in FMCG, agro-processing, manufacturing, or industrial products
	Proven track record of exceptional sales performance (evidence required)
	Strong negotiation, persuasion, and closing skills
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight targets
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Willingness to travel and work in the field
	Results-oriented mindset with high energy and discipline


Added Advantage:


	Experience selling agro-products, animal feed, starch, or industrial raw materials
	Existing customer or distributor network
	Experience in B2B and bulk sales
	Valid driver’s license
	Performance Expectation
	Candidates must be able to demonstrate past sales achievements such as:
	
		Revenue growth figures
		Volume targets exceeded
		Major accounts closed
		Market expansion results.
	
	


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter to: hr@hfap.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
